actions.text: Referred to House Committee on the Judiciary.

official_title: A bill to amend title 18 of the United States Code to make rape a Federal crime if committed after travel in interstate commerce with the intent to commit rape, and to provide for the establishment within the Federal Bureau of Investigation a Rape Prevention Information Center.

summary.text: Amends the Federal criminal code to establish a maximum penalty of up to life imprisonment for whoever: (1) travels in interstate or foreign commerce with intent to commit rape; and (2) commits or attempts to commit rape during or after such travel. Requires the Director of the Federal Bureau of Investigation to establish a Rape Prevention Information Center to collect and disseminate to State and local law enforcement agencies information with respect to rape offenses.

titles.title: A bill to amend title 18 of the United States Code to make rape a Federal crime if committed after travel in interstate commerce with the intent to commit rape, and to provide for the establishment within the Federal Bureau of Investigation a Rape Prevention Information Center.
